comment: Nearly impossible to get an A in this class. Terrible if you are trying to get into the nursing program. This class grade is based off a point system so by missing one homework or in class assignment it could be the difference of a letter grade. Tests seem great because they are take home and no lock down, but do not coordinate with the notes given

So first off, she quit mid semester. So she left my class to basically flunk with her hard tests. She made her tests take home and so she thought she could make them 1000x harder than any other professors. You probably cannot signup for her, but DO NOT.
Get's agitated when students ask questions in lecture. Tests are incredibly difficult, many tests not much other assignments to bring grade up.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Go to class, and learn her powerpoints. She is very fair with grading, and her tests come straight from the powerpoints. It's a lot of information but that the nature of Anatomy. I wish I could take her again for my upper classes. She's so sweet and willing to help you understand anything you're confused on.
shes obvi smart. just not the best at teaching and gets distracted. Anatomy is hard but she makes it even harder than it needs to be. id suggest choosing another prof.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Haack is a very tough teacher. She asks questions that she doesnt even teach in class or thats not in the book. The test are extremely hard. She gives away many extra credit opportunities, which probably is going to save my grade. If you can find another teacher, please do unless if you wanna get Cs on each test.

Dr. Haack is a very nice professor but she expects you to know the material very well and asks some crazy questions on her open ended tests. Yes, it is a lot of material to cover and its a weed out class for sure so make sure to read the book!! and youtube videos help to understand the objectives better. She does give extra credit opportunities.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: shes a very sweet lady overall. but what she teaches in class does not help w the exams.. our exams were take home but they were extremely difficult bc most of it wasnt really taught to us or in the book. the book is a must if you want to pass!

Please, whatever you do, DO NOT. Her tests are irrelevant to what she teaches in class. She gets upset with us when we dont understand everything. If you do take her, please get the book. Thats the only thing that will save you.

Absolutely the best anatomy 1 teacher. She was phenomenal. She had many many opportunities for extra credit. She is absolutely on the students side for everything. Her lectures were very clear and there were objectives to go through for every test. Overall great personality for a professor. Class is hard but she makes it manageable. LOVE. HER.

Dr. Haack really cares about her students and it is evident in her teaching. She gives you TONS of extra credit opportunities and is extremely understanding and encouraging. Shes accessible out of class and is always ready to help. This class is challenging, but as long as you do your work and the extra credit youll do well.

I absolutely love this teacher! The tests are very hard, but don't get me wrong she tries her best to prepare you. You do have to study a ton. She offers a lot of extra credit and is very accommodating. I always enjoyed going to her classes!

I. Love. This. Woman. She is so kind and caring. Her tests are difficult, but so is anatomy. You have to know your stuff to pass those tests. I have her online, and her tests come directly from her lectures and PowerPoints. She is easy to reach by email, and offers a lot of extra credit throughout the semester. Tough class, amazing lady.

Haack was so funny and very knowledgable about anatomy. She cares about her students and give so many extra credit points I would have gotten over 100 in the class. The only reason why people would rate her badly is if they didn't study. And don't get me wrong- the class is hard. You HAVE to study to get an A, but thats just anatomy. Great lady.

I didn't have Prof. Haack as my actual teacher for the lab. I had one of her TA's. But my TA, however, was amazing and really wanted us to work for our grade. She always challenged us and she had kahoots to study for the lab practicals. There are 3 lab practicals which are the only grades in the class. Be sure to study for them!

Dr. Haack is amazing! She is very clear on what she expects from you and gives ample extra credit if needed. Also, props to her for making the transition to online because of Corona stress-free. She truly cares about each of her students and wants us to succeed. Nothing bad to say about this one, take her class.

Professor Haack is very caring about your grade! Provides so much extra credit throughout the course. Tests are basically straight from her ppt, so study those very well! I barely showed up to lecture and studied off ppts at home on my own and got A's on tests. Mastering homework is graded based off of completion. No quizzes. I loved her course!

This class overall is hard, so you wont find a teacher who gives easy As. I had to work hard for my A. Go to class, pay attention, go to the SI sessions, and study! She gives a lot of extra credit and in-class extra credit, so take advantage of that.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: This was the hardest class I've ever had, I worked hard for my A. Make flashcards and memorize her power points word for word if you want to pass her tests. Dr. Haack gave us ample opportunities for extra credit, and throws out test questions if they're commonly missed. ALWAYS go to class, because she does in class extra credit too. Shes awesome!!!

Dr. Haack knows her stuff. She teaches through ppt. but goes more in depth on most slides. She outlines what is on the test, but that is not always 100% reliable, so you need to know everything you covered in class. If you don't study, learn how to. This class is not an easy A. Dr. Haack is very caring about her students and is super helpful.

This was the hardest class I have ever taken. I struggled a ton. However, Dr. Haack is hands down the best professor I've ever had. She truly cares and tries to give you opportunities to help your grade. She will challenge you so much, but she really loves her students and shows it.

Great teacher. Down to earth person. Understands that us college students cannot always perform at the best of our abilities with so much going on so she gives occasional extra credit. Dr. Haack wants you to pass but still be prepared for your future classes in your major. Very knowledgable and is always willing to help. Makes class fun.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Haack is the best professor I've had. It's a hard class so expect to put a lot of time in. Her lectures are engaging and you can tell she's extremely passionate about what she does. She really loves her students and has our best interest at heart. She offers a lot of extra credit and is super understanding. TAKE HER! You won't regret it.

Dr. Haack, is one of the most engaging teachers and she covers the content so well that you can do well without the textbook. She admitted early on that only about 10% of her students make an A, so she's not easy but she's honest, and in truth if you remember to do all of your extra credit than that A is a lot more attainable.

Dr. Haack really has a passion for A+P and seems excited to teach. 5 tests and a mandatory final, and the questions are very specific, so you have to know your stuff. She posts all her powerpoints and they have all the info you need to know for the tests. Very quick response by email, very friendly and personable, really wants you to succeed.

Dr. Haack is BY FAR one of the BEST professors I have ever had the privilege of being taught by. She truly looks like she is in her element when she teaches A&P. Dr. Haack was always more than happy to give advice when it came to study techniques for her exams, and she also provided me with guidance for majors and career pathways. A real gem!

She is a great , and is very fair with grading. If there is a question that everyone missed, she will give points back. The only downside is she is so knowledgable on the subject and expects us to be as well, which is hard when you only have 2 weeks between each exam. There are 5 exams, cumulative final, easy hw, and extra credit opportunities.

Professor Haack was nothing short of amazing! She provides opportunity to meet outside of class to help in any way she can. Going to class in not mandatory but very very helpful. Most who do not like her as a professor just did not put in the effort. This class in very content heavy and will be difficult with any professor. She is not the problem!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took Haack for anatomy 1 lecture and lab and she's amazing! 5 exams, 1 cumulative final, online homework (easy), and extra credit! She will not try to trick you, everything on her exams are in her power points. If you want to be successful, you must study, a lot. She's very nice, and is a great professor, wish she would teach a&p 2!

If you take Dr. Haack for lab, you'll have one of her TA's. My TA was great! Lab is not easy, you must study a lot and work for your grade. Attendance is a part of your overall grade and it's an easy 100, so it's in your best interest to attend each lab. 3 practicals only, so STUDY!!!

she gives a lot of extra credit which is good, but beyond that she's mediocre. all of her test info comes straight from the powerpoint so it really isn't necessary to go to class as long as you study at home. she goes on tangents in class that no one cares about but her and maybe one student. i'd to nowak before i took her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I can't say enough good things about Dr. Haack! I took her for A&P 2 and loved her so much I retook A&P 1 with her to get an A. I was thrilled she taught my patho course in nursing school. She is BRILLIANT and will challenge you, but will help you with any content you don't understand. Her PP's are clear and concise to make studying easy. TAKE HER!
Unfair professor who doesnt care about the well being of the student. Ignores students she talks to and acts youre stupid when you ask questions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: I have enjoyed Dr. Haack's class as she has been very helpful with everything this semester, she is approachable and will help you with any questions you may have. Her class is very informative because she provides you with everything that you need to be successful in the class. AP is not easy, no matter what professor you take, so study!

Dr. Haack is legit the best anatomy professor you will find. She is very compassionate, fair, and intelligent. Her class is hard though. It is a lot of very dense material and you will need to study a lot for each test, however, if you're a nursing major you're gonna have to get used to this anyways. All in all, take Haack.

I took A&P 1 to prepare for nursing school and Haack is very informative. While her exams are challenging, the information is 100% provided in her notes. You must be willing to put the time into her class or you will probably get a C at best or fail. She does provide tons of extra credit so she wants you to do well also.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The only good thing about this class is that you get an easy homework grade worth as much as a test grade. She will tell you to "focus on action potentials because I am going to hammer you on that on the test" and there will literally be 2 questions on AP's. DON'T TAKE.

Prof. Haack is great. It is obvious that she knows her information and can answer any question you would have. She assigns homework before every test. 5 tests total. None of them are dropped, but she does offer extra credit on hw and in class. Her powerpoints are very detailed, and only tests on what is on the powerpoint.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Fabulous professor. She very obviously cared about her students success. She was always available for out of class help and her lectures were amazing and her tests were only based on her lectures. She gave plenty of extra credit. Would take her a million times over again

I love her. The best anatomy teacher you will come across. Do not be scared by the other reviews. If you are a nursing student and can not pass this class with Karla then seriously... You have harder things coming. AMAZING lectures, provides so much detail and knows her stuff. You HAVE to study a lot for lecture and lab for As but you can.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She is a smart woman and obviously knows her stuff, but finds it hard to break it down to student level. Also gives attitude when asked simple questions. Lastly she is petty.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a great professor but she gives so much attitude which is unwanted when your just asking a simple question. 5 exams, none dropped, a final, and hw. She also give out extra credit so do those. Heavy memorization, she gets test info from the powerpoints.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Haack is great at lecturing and keeping you interested. You can tell she loves the subject. She does assign HW but its easy A. Test heavy but does properly prepare you for her exams! Attendance is NOT mandatory but it would benefit you to show up.

Hard class but super interesting. She was very knowledgeable and could answer almost any question. Her tests were difficult and the final was cumulative. You must put in a lot of time studying or you won't pass. Overall, I enjoyed her class because she knew what she was talking about and I now know a lot more than I did.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Difficult class. Studying is required to do well and it is possible if you put the time in. I could've made an A if I would have studied a bit harder. She explains things well and will meet with you outside of class to review tests and answer questions. There is lots of material but that was to be expected. Funny & relates class to real world.

THE BEST ANATOMY PROFESSOR YOU WILL EVER HAVE. Haack is amazing at explaining difficult topics. She's hilarious & overall a great professor. The class is HARD, what do you expect? Put the work in and you will get the grade you want. Definitely possible to get an A. Don't let the slackers fool you!! 3 exams, 1 cumulative final, and extra credit.

Dr. Haack is the most fair and honest professor at KSU. She is VERY CLEAR about what is required to pass/make an A. She doesn't waste lab time giving long lectures. Her pre-labs are very clear and to the point (finally a prof who understands).  She gives you plenty of time with lab materials. The class is difficult but at not fault of hers.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Everyone that complains about her tests being hard needs to suck it up. Her tests are fair game, with everything coming off her powerpoints. She is super helpful, clear, and such a caring professor. She is a true professional and so good at explaining things. I got an A. Wasn't easy but you can't expect people to spoonfeed you. This is college.

I really love Dr. Haack and thought she was an amazing professor! She's funny & kept lectures relateable &interesting. The material itself is very difficult but she is so helpful and answers all questions. She really WANTS you to understand and do well. She gave some extra credit. Definitely would take her again! Hard class but 1 of the best profs.

Doesn't use the book, use her powerpoints to study for the test, go to SI, and go to her office hours to get help! Pay attention during class, she is hilarious and makes things relatable. She goes fast when she is behind, but overall I love her as a person! What makes her hard are her test with multiple choice questions which ask "all above or none

Dr. Haack expects you to know your stuff. Her tests are very difficult and you will leave class feeling like you failed. She likes using test questions that have more than one answer, requiring you to know every detail. She's very nice and tries to be as helpful as she can, but it's a tough class with tough material. She gives extra credit to help.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. H is SO helpful! Her tests are a little tricky but if you study the material in depth via her PPTs you should do fine! You really have to work for an A but it is possible. If you are struggling she will try to help in every way she can. Very passionate about what she does! Love her!

Her test were very hard. She took the basics and made it harder than it needed to be. She had questions like A&B , D&B. If you're okay with a B then take her. If you want to do better, find a different professor for this course.
